item.title: OKCPS Board highlights – remediation, Native Amer focused charter, teacher survey
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
These are highlights of the regular meeting of the Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education Monday, Nov. 13. Remediation Chief Academic Officer Lynn Barnes gave a report on the further development of remediation frameworks for teachers so there will be a uniform approach in the district to remediation. Board members took considerable time asking […]

The post OKCPS Board highlights – remediation, Native Amer focused charter, teacher survey appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Retroactive pay raises completed for OKCPS employees
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
It took two board meetings in one week, but the Oklahoma City Public Schools board of education has granted retroactive pay raises to all full-time district employees. The raise goes into effect for the 2016-2017 school year now ending and will be applied to qualifying employees’ paychecks at the end of June when all public […]

The post Retroactive pay raises completed for OKCPS employees appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Budd prepares to take OKCPS board seat
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Rebecca Budd was the winner in Tuesday’s run-off race for the office No. 2 seat on the Oklahoma City Public Schools board of education. The geographic area that seat represents is the northwest corner of the sprawling district. She edged out Nick Singer by 200 votes. The final vote count was Budd, 1613 to Singer’s […]

The post Budd prepares to take OKCPS board seat appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Hupfeld donors give $106,000 for OKCPS school board campaign
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
People of financial means in Oklahoma City are determined to get Stanley Hupfeld elected chair of Oklahoma City Public Schools board of education. Latest campaign finance disclosures filed last week reveal that Hupfeld has raised $105,890 compared to opponent Paula Lewis’ $26,315. “I guess a lot of people just wanted to give me money. A […]

The post Hupfeld donors give $106,000 for OKCPS school board campaign appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
